channel.title: BBC News - Wales
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Covid: Morale on Wales' ambulances 'at rock bottom'
item.description: While military is asked for help, a frontline worker tells BBC Wales there is no let-up in demand.

item.title: Applying for university: 'I don't want a token place'
item.description: One pupil is looking for places "suitable for a black person" and another doesn't want to be a token.

item.title: Climate change: Wildlife and plant species decline 'a crisis'
item.description: Possible solutions include limiting use of fertiliser on farmland and creating new wildlife habitats.

item.title: Covid: Mark Drakeford says PCR tests should be kept for travel
item.description: Welsh government still deciding whether to follow England in reforms to international travel rules.

item.title: Covid: Deaths hit six month high in Wales, ONS figures show
item.description: There were 65 deaths involving Covid-19 registered in Wales for the latest week.

item.title: Covid: Pressure on ICU staff concerning, Hywel Dda consultant says
item.description: An ICU consultant says staff shortages are making him "dread" the winter months.

item.title: Denbighshire carer urinated on child's toothbrush, panel hears
item.description: Rebecca Spencer denies the allegations, which relate to her time working at a care home last year.

item.title: Cardiff: Further appeal to find on-the-run York rapist
item.description: Jason Longhurst was sentenced in his absence 12 days ago and has links to Cardiff, police say.

item.title: Welsh farm subsidy changes delayed again to 2025
item.description: The transitions to new subsidy arrangements following Brexit are already under way in England.

item.title: River Wye pollution: Campaigners call on poultry firms to act
item.description: Pollution in the River Wye is believed to be linked to the millions of chickens farmed in the area.

item.title: Swansea woman completes 10,000 mile fundraising walk around Britain and Ireland
item.description: Karen Penny raised more than £100,000 for charity by walking around the islands' coastlines.

item.title: Nicola Faith fishing boat: Families to set up charity to improve sea safety
item.description: Three fishermen died off the Conwy coast after the Nicola Faith sank in January.

item.title: Newport pupil looking for university 'suitable for black people'
item.description: People from minority or poorer backgrounds are less likely to be offered a place at Welsh universities.

item.title: Ceredigion: Plea to stay away from seals after pup death
item.description: People are warned not to approach seals after a pup died after visitors scared its mother away.

item.title: Covid: ICU consultant at Glangwili hospital describes pressure
item.description: An intensive care consultant says pressure is as intense as at any point during the past 18 months.

item.title: Nicola Faith fishing boat sinking: 'Grieving has only just started' for families
item.description: The families of three drowned fishermen are setting up a charity to improve sea safety.

item.title: Drink-drivers are selfish, says Ammanford woman hit by car
item.description: Finley Taylor was hit by a drink-driver as she walked her dog with her husband.

item.title: Planes turned into graffiti canvasses by street artist
item.description: Street artist Jim Vision had an idea for what to do with planes that have ended their flying days.

item.title: Women's World Cup 2023 qualifier: Estonia Women 0-1 Wales
item.description: Wales make it two wins from two games in World Cup qualifying despite being frustrated by Estonia in Parnu.

item.title: Dan James: Leeds winger plays in Carabao Cup win at Fulham after becoming a dad
item.description: Tuesday 21 September 2021 is a day Daniel James will never forget after the birth of his baby boy and playing for Leeds in Carabao Cup win at Fulham.

item.title: Estonia 0-1 Wales: Feeling frustrated after games like that is what I want - boss Grainger
item.description: Manager Gemma Grainger is pleased her Wales players felt "frustrated" by their 1-0 World Cup qualifying win against Estonia.

item.title: Graham Potter: Brighton boss 'always a Jack' as he relishes Swansea City reunion
item.description: Brighton boss Graham Potter explains why Swansea City left a mark on him ahead of Carabao Cup reunion.

item.title: Jonathan Davies: Wales centre replaces Ken Owens as Scarlets captain
item.description: Wales centre Jonathan Davies replaces Ken Owens as Scarlets captain for the 2021-22 season.

item.title: Gwasanaeth Ambiwlans Cymru: Morâl yn 'eithriadol o isel'
item.description: Holi eto am gefnogaeth filwrol, a gweithiwr rheng flaen yn dweud nad oes saib yn y galw.

item.title: Lleiafrifoedd yn 'llai tebygol o gael cynnig prifysgol'
item.description: Data yn dangos bod ymgeiswyr o leiafrifoedd ethnig i brifysgolion Cymru yn llai tebygol o gael cynnig lle nag ymgeiswyr gwyn.

item.title: Pryder am fusnesau o achos prinder byd-eang o geir newydd
item.description: Mae yna bryder y gallai busnesau yng Nghymru fynd i'r wal oherwydd y prinder byd-eang o geir newydd.

item.title: Chelsea Flower Show: 'Mae ganddo ni 2000 o cocktail sticks i osod y tomatos a'r radish'
item.description: Nid ar chwarae bach mae ennill medal aur yn y Chelsea Flower Show.

item.title: Gêm Ragbrofol Cwpan y Byd Merched 2023: Estonia 0-1 Cymru
item.description: Gôl gynnar gan Tash Harding yn rhoi buddugoliaeth gyfforddus, ond rwystredig, i Gymru yn Estonia.
